svg.text: Novel Methodological Pipeline: Explainable AI → Hypothesis Generation → DLNM Validation

g.text: XAI-guided hypothesis generation: Machine learning identifies sex-specific climate vulnerabilities
DLNM validation framework: Gold-standard environmental epidemiology confirms XAI findings
Multi-system discovery: 6 successful biomarker analyses across physiological systems
Key Innovation: First demonstration of XAI-guided environmental health hypothesis generation
Figure 1. XAI-Guided Climate-Health Discovery Pipeline: Main Findings Dashboard.
Comprehensive overview of sex-specific climate-glucose vulnerabilities and multi-system physiological interactions discovered through
novel XAI-guided hypothesis generation followed by DLNM validation. Central panel shows opposite temperature-glucose relationships
in males (protective) vs females (vulnerability). Multi-system panels demonstrate climate effects across immune, metabolic,
hematologic, and renal systems with R² values indicating model performance.
